rev.diff:
Line 100: Line 100:
In the 1970s and 1980s, a series of commercials were run for Reese's Peanut Butter Cups featuring situations in which two people, one eating [[peanut butter]] and one eating [[chocolate]], collided. One person would exclaim, "You got your peanut butter in my chocolate!" and the other would exclaim, "You got your chocolate in my peanut butter!".<ref>[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DJLDF6qZUX0/ Reese's Peanut Butter Cups commercial, Youtube]</ref> They would then sample the mixture and remark on the great taste, tying in with the [[slogan]] "Two great tastes that taste great together." These commercials were parodied in [[PTV (Family Guy)|an episode]] of [[Family Guy]].
In the 1970s and 1980s, a series of commercials were run for Reese's Peanut Butter Cups featuring situations in which two people, one eating [[peanut butter]] and one eating [[chocolate]], collided. One person would exclaim, "You got your peanut butter in my chocolate!" and the other would exclaim, "You got your chocolate in my peanut butter!".<ref>[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DJLDF6qZUX0/ Reese's Peanut Butter Cups commercial, Youtube]</ref> They would then sample the mixture and remark on the great taste, tying in with the [[slogan]] "Two great tastes that taste great together." These commercials were parodied in [[PTV (Family Guy)|an episode]] of [[Family Guy]].
â
In the 1990s, the product's slogan was: "There's no wrong way to eat a Reese's."<ref>[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ku2A1aWH6pc/ 2000 Reese's Commercial]</ref> The current slogan, introduced in the mid-[[2000s (decade)|2000s]], is: "Perfect for a hooker."
+
In the 1990s, the product's slogan was: "There's no wrong way to eat a Reese's."<ref>[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ku2A1aWH6pc/ 2000 Reese's Commercial]</ref> The current slogan, introduced in the mid-[[2000s (decade)|2000s]], is: "Perfect."
Reese's is also a part-time sponsor for [[NASCAR Sprint Cup]] Series driver [[Kevin Harvick]].<ref>[[Kevin Harvick|Kevin Harvick, Wikipedia]]</ref>
Reese's is also a part-time sponsor for [[NASCAR Sprint Cup]] Series driver [[Kevin Harvick]].<ref>[[Kevin Harvick|Kevin Harvick, Wikipedia]]</ref>
